text:
Is there a shorter way to write `for m₁ in axes(M, 1), m₂ in axes(M, 2)` in the code below? m₁ and m₂ are required.
```let M = [1 2 3; 4 5 6]
	res = Any[]
	for m₁ in axes(M, 1), m₂ in axes(M, 2)
		push!(res, (M[m₁, m₂]))
	end
	res
end```

elements.text: Is there a shorter way to write
for m₁ in axes(M, 1), m₂ in axes(M, 2)
in the code below? m₁ and m₂ are required.

let M = [1 2 3; 4 5 6]
	res = Any[]
	for m₁ in axes(M, 1), m₂ in axes(M, 2)
		push!(res, (M[m₁, m₂]))
	end
	res
end

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Success, it has been cross posted <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/56543| to Discourse>. Keep and eye out on Discourse for responses and please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benefit as well. Happy debugging!

Eachindex didn’t help by giving me a linear index. To fix that I can write this, but it’s not an improvement. :slightly_smiling_face:
```let M = [1 2 3; 4 5 6]
	res = Any[]
	for i in eachindex(view(M, 1:2, 1:3))
		@show (m₁,m₂) = i[1],i[2]
	end
	res
end```

elements.text: Eachindex didn’t help by giving me a linear index. To fix that I can write this, but it’s not an improvement.

let M = [1 2 3; 4 5 6]
	res = Any[]
	for i in eachindex(view(M, 1:2, 1:3))
		@show (m₁,m₂) = i[1],i[2]
	end
	res
end

text: The pushing to array is irrelevant, just something I added to give the for loop something to do here.

text: Hey <@U01CQTKB86N>, if you were able to find an answer here on Slack, please cross post it to Discourse via the link above. Thank you!

```julia> let M = [1 2 3; 4 5 6]
               res = Any[]
               for idx in eachindex(M)
                       push!(res, (M[idx]))
               end
               res
       end
6-element Vector{Any}:
 1
 4
 2
 5
 3
 6

julia> let M = [1 2 3; 4 5 6]
               res = Any[]
               for el in M
                       push!(res, el)
               end
               res
       end
6-element Vector{Any}:
 1
 4
 2
 5
 3
 6

julia> let M = [1 2 3; 4 5 6]
               res = Any[]
               append!(res, M)
               res
       end
6-element Vector{Any}:
 1
 4
 2
 5
 3
 6```
they all give the same result
